trans-unit.source: Create a new Application Insights resource
trans-unit.target: Create a new Application Insights resource

trans-unit.source: Set up for a new application and get a new instrumentation key. Application Insights monitors the performance and usage of live applications.
trans-unit.target: Set up for a new application and get a new instrumentation key. Application Insights monitors the performance and usage of live applications.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Application Insights resource
trans-unit.target: Create a new Application Insights resource

trans-unit.source: [AZURE。含まれます <link><linkText>app-insights-selector-get-started</linkText><title></title></link>]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE。含まれます <link><linkText>app-insights-selector-get-started</linkText><title></title></link>]

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio Application Insights displays data about your application in a Microsoft Azure resource.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio Application Insights displays data about your application in a Microsoft Azure resource.

trans-unit.source: Creating a new resource is therefore part of <link><linkText>setting up Application Insights to monitor a new application[start]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Creating a new resource is therefore part of <link><linkText>setting up Application Insights to monitor a new application[start]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In many cases, this can be done automatically by the IDE, and that's the recommended way where it's available.
trans-unit.target: In many cases, this can be done automatically by the IDE, and that's the recommended way where it's available.

trans-unit.source: But in some cases, you create a resource manually.
trans-unit.target: But in some cases, you create a resource manually.

trans-unit.source: After you have created the resource, you get its instrumentation key and use that to configure the SDK in the application.
trans-unit.target: After you have created the resource, you get its instrumentation key and use that to configure the SDK in the application.

trans-unit.source: This sends the telemetry to the resource.
trans-unit.target: This sends the telemetry to the resource.

trans-unit.source: Sign up to Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Sign up to Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: If you haven't got a <link><linkText>Microsoft account, get one now</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't got a <link><linkText>Microsoft account, get one now</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: (If you use services like Outlook.com, OneDrive, Windows Phone, or XBox Live, you already have a Microsoft account.)
trans-unit.target: (If you use services like Outlook.com, OneDrive, Windows Phone, or XBox Live, you already have a Microsoft account.)

trans-unit.source: You'll also need a subscription to <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You'll also need a subscription to <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If your team or organization has an Azure subscription, the owner can add you to it, using your Windows Live ID.
trans-unit.target: If your team or organization has an Azure subscription, the owner can add you to it, using your Windows Live ID.

trans-unit.source: Or you can create a new subscription.
trans-unit.target: Or you can create a new subscription.

trans-unit.source: The free trial lets you try everything in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The free trial lets you try everything in Azure.

trans-unit.source: After the trial period expires, you might find the pay-as-you-go subscription appropriate, as you won't be charged for free services.
trans-unit.target: After the trial period expires, you might find the pay-as-you-go subscription appropriate, as you won't be charged for free services.

trans-unit.source: When you've got access to a subscription, login to Application Insights at <link><linkText>http://portal.azure.com</linkText><title></title></link>, and use your Live ID to login.
trans-unit.target: When you've got access to a subscription, login to Application Insights at <link><linkText>http://portal.azure.com</linkText><title></title></link>, and use your Live ID to login.

trans-unit.source: Create an Application Insights resource
trans-unit.target: Create an Application Insights resource

trans-unit.source: In the <link><linkText>portal.azure.com</linkText><title></title></link>, add an Application Insights resource:
trans-unit.target: In the <link><linkText>portal.azure.com</linkText><title></title></link>, add an Application Insights resource:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click New, Application Insights</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click New, Application Insights</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Application type affects what you see on the overview blade and the properties available in metric explorer[metrics].
trans-unit.target: Application type affects what you see on the overview blade and the properties available in metric explorer[metrics].

trans-unit.source: If you don't see your type of app, choose one of the web types for web pages, and one of the phone types for other devices.
trans-unit.target: If you don't see your type of app, choose one of the web types for web pages, and one of the phone types for other devices.

trans-unit.source: Resource group is a convenience for managing properties like access control.
trans-unit.target: Resource group is a convenience for managing properties like access control.

trans-unit.source: If you have already created other Azure resources, you can choose to put this new resource in the same group.
trans-unit.target: If you have already created other Azure resources, you can choose to put this new resource in the same group.

trans-unit.source: Subscription is your payment account in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Subscription is your payment account in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Location is where we keep your data.
trans-unit.target: Location is where we keep your data.

trans-unit.source: Currently it can't be changed.
trans-unit.target: Currently it can't be changed.

trans-unit.source: Add to startboard puts a quick-access tile for your resource on your Azure Home page.
trans-unit.target: Add to startboard puts a quick-access tile for your resource on your Azure Home page.

trans-unit.source: Recommended.
trans-unit.target: Recommended.

trans-unit.source: When your app has been created, a new blade opens.
trans-unit.target: When your app has been created, a new blade opens.

trans-unit.source: This is where you'll see performance and usage data about your app.
trans-unit.target: This is where you'll see performance and usage data about your app.

trans-unit.source: To get back to it next time you login to Azure, look for your app's quick-start tile on the start board (home screen).
trans-unit.target: To get back to it next time you login to Azure, look for your app's quick-start tile on the start board (home screen).

trans-unit.source: Or click Browse to find it.
trans-unit.target: Or click Browse to find it.

trans-unit.source: Copy the instrumentation key
trans-unit.target: Copy the instrumentation key

trans-unit.source: The instrumentation key identifies the resource that you created.
trans-unit.target: The instrumentation key identifies the resource that you created.

trans-unit.source: You'll need it to give to the SDK.
trans-unit.target: You'll need it to give to the SDK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click Essentials, click the Instrumentation Key, CTRL+C</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click Essentials, click the Instrumentation Key, CTRL+C</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Install the SDK in your app
trans-unit.target: Install the SDK in your app

trans-unit.source: Install the Application Insights SDK in your app.
trans-unit.target: Install the Application Insights SDK in your app.

trans-unit.source: This step depends heavily on the type of your application.
trans-unit.target: This step depends heavily on the type of your application.

trans-unit.source: Use the instrumentation key to configure <link><linkText>the SDK that you install in your application[start]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Use the instrumentation key to configure <link><linkText>the SDK that you install in your application[start]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The SDK includes standard modules that send telemetry without you having to write any code.
trans-unit.target: The SDK includes standard modules that send telemetry without you having to write any code.

trans-unit.source: To track user actions or diagnose issues in more detail, <link><linkText>use the API[api]</linkText><title></title></link> to send your own telemetry.
trans-unit.target: To track user actions or diagnose issues in more detail, <link><linkText>use the API[api]</linkText><title></title></link> to send your own telemetry.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>See telemetry data
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>See telemetry data

trans-unit.source: Close the quick start blade to return to your application blade in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Close the quick start blade to return to your application blade in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Click the Search tile to see <link><linkText>Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title></link>, where the first events will appear.
trans-unit.target: Click the Search tile to see <link><linkText>Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title></link>, where the first events will appear.

trans-unit.source: Click Refresh after a few seconds if you're expecting more data.
trans-unit.target: Click Refresh after a few seconds if you're expecting more data.

trans-unit.source: Creating a resource automatically
trans-unit.target: Creating a resource automatically

trans-unit.source: You can write a <link><linkText>PowerShell script</linkText><title></title></link> to create a resource automatically.
trans-unit.target: You can write a <link><linkText>PowerShell script</linkText><title></title></link> to create a resource automatically.
